cfswitch.cfcase: The Verity or Solr indexing engines allows you to easily develop search capabilities for your ColdFusion applications. A Verity or Solr collection is a group of information that can be indexed and searched as a set. Use this form to create and manage your Verity or Solr collections.
A name for your collection is required.
A path for your verity collection is required.

cfcase.cfoutput: Optimizing a collection can take several minutes. #CALLER.nl# Proceed?
Purging a collection cannot be undone. #CALLER.nl# Remove all indices in this collection?
Deleting a collection cannot be undone. #CALLER.nl# Destroy this collection?

cfswitch.cfcase:
Unable to retrieve collections from any of the Search Services.
Please verify that atleast one of ColdFusion Search Services is installed and running.
Please enter a valid name for this collection.
Please enter a valid Directory Path for this collection.

cfcase.cfoutput: Collection #CALLER.collectionname# Indexed: #CALLER.indexResult.inserted# files inserted, #CALLER.indexResult.updated# files updated.
Alias #FORM.SolrAliasName# created for #CALLER.collectionname#.

cfswitch.cfcase: A new collection name is required.
Could not determine collection path locally. See the section Term Highlighting in the Developing Coldfusion 9 Applications to enable term highlighting for the entire document.

cfoutput.cfoutput: Term highlighting enabled for #CALLER.collectionname#. Reindex collection for these changes to take effect

cfswitch.cfcase: Data & Services > ColdFusion Collections > Manage Collection
Data & Services > ColdFusion Collections > Index Collection

NOTE: Because you have a remote Solr server configured, you must ensure that the documents to be indexed are accessible from the ColdFusion server machine as well as the computer on which the Solr search services run. Also, if the local and remote file paths do not match exactly, you can use the Remote Directory Path field to define a prefix that maps the local path to the path on the remote Solr host.

NOTE: Because you have a remote K2 server configured, you must ensure that the documents to be indexed are accessible from the ColdFusion server machine as well as the computer on which the K2 search services run. Also, if the local and remote file paths do not match exactly, you can use the Remote Directory Path field to define a prefix that maps the local path to the path on the remote K2 host.

cfcase.p: By default, Solr highlights searched terms available in the summary content. Click Enable to highlight contents in the entire document. After you enable/disable, reindex the collection.

cfswitch.cfcase: Note: Enabling term highlighting for the entire document increases index size.

cfcase.p: By default, Solr highlights searched terms only in the summary content. See the section Term Highlighting in the Developing Coldfusion 9 Applications to enable term highlighting for the entire document.

cfswitch.cfcase: Verity K2 Server Configuration information updated.

You can install and configure the Verity K2 search service on a host other than the one on which ColdFusion is running.In this case, you can configure the host that ColdFusion uses when performing search operations. If you have purchased the Verity K2 Enterprise product, you may need to configure the aliases, ports and login information of the services that ColdFusion uses. Click the Advanced button to configure these values. You should not need to change the advanced values if you are running with the ColdFusion-installed version of Verity.

By default, the K2 Enterprise product requires authentication for the K2 Administration server. You will need to enter a user name and password below if you have installed the K2 product so that it requires authentication.
Use this page to migrate your Verity collections to Solr collections.
A name for your solr collection is required.
A path for your Solr collection is required.

Unable to retrieve collections from the ColdFusion Search Service.
Please verify that the ColdFusion Search Server is installed and running.
There are no Verity collections to migrate

You can install and configure the Solr search service on a host other than the one on which ColdFusion is running.In this case, you can configure the host that ColdFusion uses when performing search operations. Click the Show Advanced Settings to configure these values. You should not need to change the advanced values if you are running with the ColdFusion-installed version of Solr.

cfswitch.cfcase: Please enter a valid host name or IP address ( xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx ).
Please enter an alias. The default K2 Admin alias is 'ColdFusionK2'.
Please enter a valid K2 Admin port. The default K2 Admin port is 9950.
Please enter an alias. The default K2 server alias is 'ColdFusionK2_server1'.
Please enter a valid K2 Server port. The default K2 Server port is 9920.
Please enter an alias. The default K2 index alias is 'ColdFusionK2_indexserver1'.
Please enter a valid K2 Index port. The default K2 Index port is 9960.

cfswitch.cfcase: Please enter a valid Solr Admin port. The default Admin port is 8983.
Please enter a webapp. The default Solr webapp is 'solr'.
Enter the buffer limit in MB. The default value is 40 MB
